org.jacktheclipper.frontend.service

Class OuService

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jacktheclipper.frontend.service.OuService

  • @Service
public class OuService
extends java.lang.Object
    Handles all request to the backend which concern organizational units. This includes e. g. requesting an organizational unit's settings or getting a list of all existing organizational units.

        public OuService()

    • Method Detail

      • getOrganizationalUnits

        public java.util.List<OrganizationalUnit> getOrganizationalUnits(java.util.UUID userId)
        Returns a list of all currently existing organizational units. This does not separte between top level organizational units (like BMW, Audi, etc.) and lower level organizational units (like BMW/Marketing, Audi/HR, etc.).
        Parameters:
        userId - This parameter is currently unused. Stay tuned for all its possible uses
        Returns:
        A list of all currently existing organizational units

      • getOuSettings

        public OrganizationalUnitSettings getOuSettings(java.util.UUID ouId)
        Returns an organizational units settings
        Parameters:
        ouId - The id of the organizational unit for which the settings are requested
        Returns:
        The settings of the specified organizational unit or null if the unit does not exist

      • getTopLevelOrganizations

        public java.util.List<Tuple<java.util.UUID,java.lang.String>> getTopLevelOrganizations()
        Returns a list of all toplevel organizations. Those are childs of the root OrganizationalUnit SYSTEM. SYSTEM is also returned and needs to be filtered out
        Returns:
        A list of all toplevel organizations but only their UUID and name

      • updateCache

        @Scheduled(fixedRate=120000L)
private void updateCache()
        Updates nameToUuidCache in a regular interval. The interval is between the begin of method execution. The old call to the method does not have to be completed before the next method call. The interval itself is a magic number and currently sits at 2 minutes.

      • mapOuNameToOuUUID

        public java.util.UUID mapOuNameToOuUUID(java.lang.String ouName)
        Determines the UUID corresponding to the supplied name. This allows for using a HashMap as a cache since it might be useful.
        Parameters:
        ouName - The name for which the UUID should be found
        Returns:
        The UUID corresponding to the supplied name. Might be null if the name does not exist or the cache was not updated fast enough.
